content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.12 - Executive order no. 12: establishing the committee to evaluate and recommend candidates for appointment as interim district attorney or sheriff

State Regulations
WHEREAS, from time to time a vacancy may occur for the
office of district attorney or sheriff; WHEREAS, district attorneys and sheriffs are constitutional
officers with broad law enforcement duties within their jurisdictions; WHEREAS, the County Law authorizes the Governor to fill a
vacancy for the office of district attorney by appointment, and to fill a
vacancy for the office of sheriff by appointment with the advice and consent of
the Senate; WHEREAS, the first obligation of government is to protect
its citizens from crime and violence; public confidence in the criminal justice
system has been eroded; and district attorneys and sheriffs exercise important
responsibilities in the administration of the criminal justice system; WHEREAS, citizens within a county in which a vacancy for
district attorney or sheriff occurs must be served by highly qualified public
officials until such time that they duly elect a candidate to hold such office; and
WHEREAS, a screening committee should evaluate the
qualifications of potential appointees and recommend to the Governor those
persons who are highly qualified to hold the office of district attorney or
sheriff; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the Committee to Evaluate
and Recommend Candidates for Appointment as Interim District Attorney or

Sheriff, now by Executive Order: I. Membership. Members of the committee shall consist of Paul L. Schectman, the State Director of Criminal Justice, who shall be the chairperson
of the Committee, Michael C. Finnegan, the Counsel to the Governor, Victoria A. Graffeo, the Solicitor General, John F. O'Mara, former President of the New

York State District Attorney's Association and the Hon. Lawrence H. Cooke, former Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals. Members of the committee shall
receive no compensation for their service, but shall be entitled to
reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in connection with the
performance of their duties. II. Powers and Responsibilities. The committee shall, whenever a vacancy occurs for the
office of district attorney or sheriff: 1. consider and evaluate the qualifications
of any candidate proposed to it by any person or group; 2. conduct all appropriate inquiries into the
background and qualifications of any candidate; 3. recommend for appointment only those
candidates who, as determined by a majority vote of all members of the
committee, are highly qualified for the office for which they are being
considered; 4. in reviewing and
evaluating the qualifications of candidates, each committee member shall give
primary consideration to the quality of a candidate's intellect, judgment, temperament, character and experience, and shall not give any consideration
whatsoever to the race, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation
or political party affiliation of a candidate. All records and deliberations of the committee and all
communications to the Committee with respect to a candidate's qualifications
shall be held in confidence and shall not be disclosed to anyone other than the

Governor, Counsel to the Governor or their designees. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, information submitted to the Committee may be disclosed to the

Senate when necessary for constitutional confirmation and to any other person
or organization if disclosure is required in connection with the performance of
official duties. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: April 25, 1995
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
